class_notes: (THIS CLASS IS FULL; contact candlerregistrar@emory.edu to request to be placed on the waiting list) (ONLINE: live synchronous meeting Thursdays 2:30pm-4:30pm; remaining contact time fulfilled via asynchronous online engagement)
course_description: A study of those contemporary voices in Christian ethics making critical claims on the behalf of the well-being of women. Topics may include: the challenge of difference (racial, economic, sexual), violence against women, family roles, reproductive technologies, women and children in poverty, ecofeminism. (Race, Ethnicity, and Gender)
